name: ADVANCED TOPICS IN WRIT: THE ART OF EATING

section.name: ADVANCED TOPICS IN WRIT: THE ART OF EATING

values.comments:
This course was designed to transform students into more effective and graceful writers, using food and the art of eating as a focus. Food is about more than just eating, it is about appetite, taste, emotion, conversation, and culture. The art of eating is a class designed to educate your palates and sensibilities via writing. The two central texts of this class are: American Food Writing: An Anthology with Classic Recipes and The Gastronomical Me, by M.F.K. Fisher. Last, you will also have the opportunity to take field trips and discover Philadelphia through its food.

Many students found the class to be a positive experience in several ways. “Food is a bonus!” one student pointed out. However, many found that the format of the Critical Writing seminar was not conducive to learning in this particular class, and in fact “hampered” their creativity. Students who were disappointed with the overall Critical Writing seminar structure said, “you might as well take [a writing seminar] from a professor who actually apologizes for having to teach the content.”

Professor Devaney—described in terms such as “amazing”, “eccentric”, “down to earth”, and “hilarious”—earned applause for being able to compensate for some of the problems attributed to the Writing Seminar structure. “The things we talked about post-Bruffee were definitely worth it,” one student said. Another of his 16 students, however, noted that he had trouble remembering students’ names despite an entire semester’s worth of work on their writing.
